p: The hemotropic M. suis also expresses immunodominant adhesin MGS1 (now named GAPDH), which shares a high homology within GAPDH in M. penetrans and can interact with Band3 and glycophorin A in erythrocytes [ 55, 56]. Likewise, the adhesion characteristics of erythrocyte-binding adhesin O-sialoglycoprotein endopeptidase (OSGEP) of M. suis is similar to that of GAPDH [ 56].
